Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackmac2
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a stay at the Park Hotel and found it fantastic. It was great value for money and the location was excellent: opposite the train station, meaning quick access to the airport (the train journey involves one change at Passeig de Gracias), and close to a very beautiful park and great zoo, as well as Las Ramblas. The beach also isn't very far and is within walking distance; as is the cable-car. The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. They provided us with a map and the check-in/check-out process was very swift. Only two small disadvantages with the rooms: it can be a bit noisy when people are walking around on the corridors as the walls are thin (we were next to the lifts) and the rooms are fairly small.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: spacepam
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous review from SLM2, location is excellant walking distance from the main town, Las Ramblas etc, room was cosy did miss not having the ability to make a coffee when wanted too. Please be aware that it can't be reach directly from the main line from the airport, you either have to change onto another main line into Estació de França or the metro into Barceloneta.Staff at the hotel were very friendly & halpful at all times. Good little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SLM2
Reviews.Content: Hotel well located with helpful staff. Close to the water front, las ramblas, ciutat vella and Sants train station (for Sitges). Restaurants and shops around. Rooms have all mod com (no kettle), bit small but ok for short stays. Good water pressure in the bathroom. No noise proof doors so can get noise from both corridor and street. Try to avoid rooms 231, 331 etc as they are right in front of the lifts and the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great wee hotel!”
Reviews.Author: renegado_12
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, I was worried that it was going to be of poor quality, due to it's small lobby and seedy street appearance. However I was pleasantly surprised when I checked into my room of the quality of this hotel. The rooms were tastefully decorated, and had modern fittings. I don't think any of the rooms offer much of a view, other than the street below however. Unfortunately I lost the photos I took of the room itself... Park has a boutique feel, and the wooden spiral staircase leading all the way to the top of the building is really neat. The staff downstairs at the front desk and bar were great. I had a parcel delivered from amazon.com to the hotel and it was delivered to my room. The best thing about this property is the amount of things you can do in the local area surrounding the hotel. There are several restaurants nearby, cafe's and boutiques crammed into the alleyways behind the hotel. A short stroll from the front of the hotel is the Barcelona waterfront / harbour area which is great on a sunny day. The hotel is also easily accessible to the Barceloneta metro station which is a 5minute walk across the road. Alternatively you can walk to the Jaume I metro station in 10 or so minutes, through the alleys behind the hotel, this is a magical walk. We dined most nights at the restraunt in a street beside the hotel called Salero, which served Asian Fusion as well as local type food. I would love to visit Barcelona again in the near future, and this hotel is a fantastic, mid-range establishment to base yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Central and clean”
Reviews.Author: Crasten
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right at the edge of the old centre. Loads of restaurants and bars are nearby. I had a single room, and the sleeping area was as big as the bathroom, which was a first for me. The bed was of mediocre quality, you could feel the springs in your back. The room was clean though and the service + breakfast good. Price quality is not the greatest, but I paid more because of a congress. All in all it was a good stay, but I think there's better places to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaximBezembinder
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in a nice area of Barcelona, within walking distance of many of the major sights. Room was clean, with an excellent (single) bed. If you would like a larger bed you would have to book a double room! Staff was very pleasant and the breakfast was very nice too. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo_Trader
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location - within walking distance of the beach and also great tapas bars and directly opposite the train station. The outside is wonderfully retro and there are really nice 1950s/60s features inside. We didn't interact much with the hotel staff, but our rooms were always clean and the reception staff helpful if asked. We didn't book an inclusive breakfast but instead went out to one of the street cafes outside which was a great experience, especially for the people watching. The hotel seems to be in the middle of an upgrade - we had two rooms for our group and one was better equipped than the other - so it might be worth specifying when you make a booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near all the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: brightsouthernstar
Reviews.Content: I have spent three nights at this hotel . Although The hotel was being refurbished and the lobby loOked lik a building site, the rooms are very nice and comfortable. The hotel has an agreement with a car park nearby but at €25 it makes it quite expensive. Plenty of nice tapas bars and restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: holly555326
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the new year period. The hotel is in an excellent location and ideal for getting to main areas ie: marina, beach, el born, las ramblas, gothic quarter ect ect. The hotel is small and we booked 2 superior rooms and ours had the largest balcony we have ever had. The rooms were very clean, the staff friendly and helpful, we did not have breakfast buffet but had drinks and snacks from the bar which were very good. Excellent restaurants, cafes, bars and shops near by in el born. El born is fantastic and felt very safe there. After reading other reviews about safety and crime in barcelona on this site we were very worried. If you take normal precautions as in any large city you will be fine. We were a party of 4 and all had a brilliant time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, not too crowded area”
Reviews.Author: sultan-pirouette
Reviews.Content: October 21, real nice small hotel. good value for price. Personel was very nice and helpful. room clean, good size according to Europe standards. quiet, not very far from ocean. Fantastic large cold and hot buffet breakfast for 12 Euros, worth the money. the employee at the buffet was very nice and so helpfull. Desk ordered a taxi (safer than taking one on the street) to cruiseship.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Cemma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing area for getting around Barcelona. The rooms where a nice size and all the staff where fine but nothing outstanding. The breakfast was nothing special and the room was a squash when full. I would definitely stay here again if only for the location. There are plenty of nice restaurants near by, we tried the tapas and the pizza place which where only a 5 minute walk away and we had some very tasty food. We also tried the cocktail bar next door had great cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant central location”
Reviews.Author: claire d
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a brilliant central location, close to both the marina and the very quirky El Born, lots of great wee shops and places to eat all day. We paid a little extra for this hotel than others available, and although room was clean, it was not spotless. The reception staff were not friendly at all and didn't give the right impression when checking in and out. Good enough size room, but lift was a bit unpredictable. Definitely worth it for the location though.

Reviews.Title: “Solid place with great location”
Reviews.Author: snoels
Reviews.Content: Close to Barceloneta metro stop, tourist bus stop & Picasso Museum. Good firm bed & strong shower. Large tv, clean room, decent breakfast and my favorite- the mechanical black-out shade. Staff wasn't terribly warm but helpful. I would bring all your own toiletries- they were not the best quality. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CH_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel makes it a good base to visit the city. Barceloneta metro station is a 3 minutes walk away. The Ciutadela park and the Zoo is 100m away from the hotel. The harbor and the beaches are also easily accessed by foot. If you take the train from the airport, change at Passeig de Gracia for a train to Estacio de França (same platform). That station is situated right across the street, in front of the hotel. If you have bagages, this is far better than taking the Aerobus + metro, as metro stations in Barcelona have often a lot of stairs, without escalator. Room had a large, comfortable bed. A huge plasma TV. A terrace. Although the street in front of the hotel is very busy, there was no nuisance from the street, as the windows offered a good noise isolation. Room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “wise choice”
Reviews.Author: sx_Greece
Reviews.Content: although it is not located close to Ramblas, the good thing is that it gives direct access to the airport from Estacio Franca (train station), which is located just oposite, and has also close access to metro. You will not be thrilled from the outside view of the hotel, nor from the reception and the elevator, but rooms are cosy and very clean. In general, rooms have nothing special, but it is an organised hotel, with good breakfast, in a quiet location close to Barceloneta and El Born District, with very nice night life. Prices are not that reasonable but this is Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SW_Sydney
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Barcelona and wasn't my first choice of hotels. The other hotels that I tried were all booked out 4 months in advanced due to the Le Merci festival. Park Hotel was recommended by one of the other hotels, and ended up being a great choice. We stayed for one week and had no problems. Its in a great location. Forget about Ramblas, the Gothic and Born areas was great. No where near as touristy as many other parts, GREAT food and bars down the various lane ways, and many of the best museums. Plenty of transport for getting around town as well. The Hotel was modern and clean. The showers were hot and strong, the free WiFi worked well, staff were friendly & helpful and the AC was good. It can be a little noisy at night, but hey, it's Barcelona and you should be on the street contributing to the noise :->. Take a room on the higher floors and close the windows and you probably won't hear a thing. It was a bit pricey for Barcelona, but this may have been due to the festival. I can recommend this hotel, the area, and being there during Merci (great festival and one big party all weekend)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: marjan_k
Reviews.Content: Very nice and central, and after the horrible experience in Lyon, staff been very friendly and found me a room with a reasonable price. Room looks fabulous, very clean, water pressure is awesome. Nice and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: aabrams
Reviews.Content: This was a great, small hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was a bit small, but very clean. Didn't do the buffett breakfast for 12 Euros, rather I had breakfast at the hotel bar or just 2 minutes away were lots of coffee/tapas places for breakfast. Breakfast for me was a croissant and a coffee, you can get juice as well. The hotel is across the street from the Renfe (commuter rail) station - very easy to get to. Very centrally located and near the subway, most things are in walking distance. The one drawback is at night, the noise level goes up. The double glass window panes keep the noise level out, but you give up fresh air. This is a great place for your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: oanach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this summer and it was perfect: Cheap, central (right in the middle of Las Ramblas). The AC in the rooms works perfect and there is no noise whatsoever! However, avoid to have breakfast at the bar nearby (very expensive compared to the rest of the Gothic Quarters)

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: spudcini
Reviews.Content: Very nice location in the Gothic quarter, on arrival the desk person mapped out a 2 hour walk for us to see the area before a late dinner, what a nice intro to the city. The rooms are clean and nice and quiet on the 6th floor where we stayed. The breakfast if not included should be avoided. They ask 12 euro and for a small portion of that you can get much better fare at one of the many bakeries and small walk up shops in the area. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: mothersap
Reviews.Content: As noted by other reviewers, what makes this hotel a good choice in Barcelona is the location. You are within easy walking distance of the southern end of La Rambla, the Gothic Quarter, El Born, shops, restaurants, etc. The room was nothing special in terms of style and did not have a view, but it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is tiny. One suggestion would be to add shelves that could be used to place a toiletry bag. Most of the staff I interacted with were friendly. When I arrived early in the morning Barcelona time from my overnight flight from the U.S., they permitted an early check-in. I did not have the hotel breakfast, but the coffee at the shop next door is strong and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123walker
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is perfect. you can walk to the old city an barceloneta the city beach. the harbour is not far away either. the stuff is friendly and very helpfull. i liked the hotel. it has a relaxed feel. the breakfast was good. a huge variation. the hotel bar is nice too. the rooms are modern and clean. i can recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - OK Price”
Reviews.Author: Crystal1210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to everything and is within walking distance of everything else... Beaches, shops, restaurants, etc. The rooms were very clean however, my AC wouldn't go any higher than a 'Medium' setting. My room was on the third floor and I could still hear everything going on below at street level. I'd say the walls were thick enough, but the windows let in much noise even when closed. The staff was not overly friendly but they certainly weren't rude either. Overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, within walking distance from the beach and the Gothic Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ajordell
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here on holidays with my girlfriend. We opted for a superior room, and got a rather large room with a balcony on the second floor, facing the main road. I was a bit worried about traffic noise, but with closed windows and air-condition on, this was not an issue. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Barceloneta Beach and the Gothic Quarter are within 10-15 minutes walking distance. The neighborhood immediately northwest of the hotel is also nice, with shops and restaurants. If your breakfast is not included, I would recommend the adjacent bar/café. The hotel clerks seems to order their food from there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Beautiful Views from Window”
Reviews.Author: epickett23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I didn't plan to stay here but when the hostel we made reservations at was overbooked, they put us here for a night. It was very nice and clean. The room was little (which I learned is the case at any inexpensive lodging in Spain) but the window opened to a little side street which was a great perk. It was so nice to look down the street at all the buildings with balconies and have a nice breeze in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean room good AC unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DrCro
Reviews.Content: I do recommend this hotel as it was clean, well priced and easily accesible to transportation. The staff came across as rude but the stay worked out. The room was exceedingly small but I was ok with that.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: alisa_seo
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by some of the pictures which make the hotel look old. The hotel is beautiful, very modern, and the staff are wonderful. They are multilingual and have great tips for where to eat/what to do. They even held our bag for several days while we went to another city and then came back. Several blocks from park, walking distance to beach, lots of little shops and restaurants nearby. Great area and good pricing for this hotel. We traveled with our 2 .5 year old and it was a hit. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaATX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for a short visit to Barcelona. The hotel staff is friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very clean and even though we were near the elevator, we didnt hear it at night. The train station is across the street; easy access to the airport. Also Cal Pep is around the corner, one of the Best restaurants in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, and OK Location”
Reviews.Author: Addled_in_Ades
Reviews.Content: I seem to have been very lucky in that my room was extremely quiet. Very good staff on arrival and a good breakfast room. The hotel is in an OK part of town, a few minutes from everything including the beach. Everyting works well - aircon, lifts, bathroom etc. Had a great sleep before the long flight home, which is just what I want. Felt very safe and loved the bar area downstairs on the street.

Reviews.Title: “a very decent hotel; 3 star so over 100 euros/night, but OK”
Reviews.Author: colinwb
Reviews.Content: We use the PARK every time we visit BCN but that is because we use Estacion Francia (railway) over the road, we canarrive late ex UK then leave our bags with the concierge(sp?) while we soend the morning in the lovely area of BCN known as Born. Go for the superior twin or double if you can afford it and get a balcony over the main street. We are looking at the Oasis next time as it might be cheaper but whenever I'm on expenses we'll use the Park. There's a fab pizza place nearby that does great pasta dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park Hotel near Park”
Reviews.Author: Arefiev
Reviews.Content: We were there in september 2010. There was located close to the center. The room was very comfortable and the standard of cleanliness was excellent. Staff ware friendly. There was lots of noise from the streets outside. And the bed was too hard. There weren't swimming pool or gym in hotel. Quite and location was fine. We were visiting the Fire Show at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: Meapale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park overnight en route to France for business. It was the perfect location, as i was leaving out of Estacio de Franca across the street, early the next morning. The room was clean and the bathroom quite large with a little balcony. Water pressure was perfect. My room faced the small side street, so it was rather quiet and very charming. Bed was OK, but i woke up rested. Grabbed coffee and pastry at the bar downstairs (no time for dining room breakfast service) and it was exactly what i needed: Strong and fast. Location is in El Born and some of my favorite places, so my overnight in BCN felt more like a mini vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Anooos
Reviews.Content: The location is near the city center, 10 minutes walk, staff are trying to help and so friendly, great value for money, rooms are clean

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but Poor Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oirish_10
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I also had the security issue outlined by another reviewer. Came back to my hotel room on Friday only to see the door had been left OPEN by the cleaning staff which alarmed me as my passport and personal items were locked in the staff. Anyone could have come in and ransacked the room. Told the reception person who looked disinterested and said he would follow up. But the hotel staff in general were not approachable and the hotel was OK - clean and good location - but very noisy on the side street at three in the morning. I would not score it very highly for these reasons. Barcelona is a great place to visit and the Ciutat Vella and port area nearby are wonderful however.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, secure,walking distance to everything !”
Reviews.Author: bondiiceberg
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Barcelona with my 15 year old son. I had read a few reviews on this website and saw some negative reviews about the security and to be honest I thought, well if it looks in the slightest way insecure I am prepared to lose my deposit and look for another hotel. We met the boss who showed us to our room it was sparkling clean and was well located from the La Rampla,.beach, cafes,restaurants.bars. Included a buffet breakfast. Costs about 35 Euros by taxi from the airport. It felt very safe.As I am totally paranoid about security. So for the guy who lost gear ? Love to know the full story ! I would stay there again without any problem. Clean and well located. And well priced !

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Detken
Reviews.Content: Good Location in El Born, quiet despite surroundings. Good breakfast buffet in pleasant room ambience. Had a small single bedded room on top floor (7th) - clean and sufficient. Some problems with computer / door keys but very friendly staff so resolved politely and efficiently. Would recommend as location for weekend sightseeing .

Reviews.Title: “Ok - not really worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Penelope_Pitstop24
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the end of a long weekend with a girlfriend in Barcelona, our return flight was cancelled so we stayed in this hotel for one night. It's ok, the reception staff are really friendly but the rooms are a bit dingy, old-fashioned and could've been cleaner. It's in a great location but not really worth the money, stay in the Hotel del Mar just across the road which is much nicer and much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jmlrusb
Reviews.Content: I stayed there when in Barcelona Attending a congress in Town, we were a big group of students and We found everything perfect for our needs, The building is considered an iconic piece of architecture in the city, rooms were nice, clean and comfortable but a little bit small.The Hotel is close to everything, Perfect location, close to El barrio gotico, The zoo, La barceloneta, El muelle Olimpico, & Buses and Metro station close to it. It is in front of the France Train Station too

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Clean room!”
Reviews.Author: ccouvi5898
Reviews.Content: Overall we found our stay at the Park Hotel to be a good experience. We were there in June 2010 and it was hot. The only things I can complain about are that the room temperature was only cool, not very comfortable (you can't adjust it), no washcloths, and no 110-v plug adapters (I do realize that we should have brought our own, but for the convenience of those who didn't, it would've been nice to have been furnished with one). But in all fairness, ALL three hotels we stayed at in Barcelona had my same complaints. On the plus side was that the room was clean. This, above all, is most important to me. Also, the room was a nice size and the bed was comfortable. The furnishings were nice and updated. The location was great! We walked around at night and enjoyed looking at all the really old buildings and alleys and restaurants. Watch out for the Tapas bars though. They are looking for those that are unsuspecting of how to order, as we were. Before we knew what had happened we found that we had ordered 4 entree's. We said that we wanted a particular dish, then changed our minds to order something else, and they added both of them to our order without taking note that we changed our minds. Also watch out for the second waiter coming to your table and making "suggestions" for dishes... they write those down too. Oh, and watch out for Pickpockets! They are all over the place and have methods of stealing that you've never heard of. *Suggestion: Bring a battery-operated fan with plenty of batteries. Good thing we did!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jc631
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel was a great choice for our trip to Barcelona. It has the perfect location (less than 5 minutes to Parck Ciutadella, 10 minutes walk to the beach, 15 to Las Ramblas, and next to the Barceloneta Metro). The room was very clean and a decent size for three people. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: apaiva
Reviews.Content: Good location. 7th floor rooms are not noisy, but they are warm. AC worked good. Wifi was good, internet behind adult firewall... Nightspots in "el Born" at walking distance. Beach, Picasso museum, etc. I used the safe, just because and I was aware of risks. Great architecture!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: katdarcy
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to warn other travelers about the Park Hotel. We stayed here at the recommendation of a friend. The hotel is in a great location and has comfortable rooms, but we were burgled on the second night of our stay along with at least four other people in the hotel. Thieves got into our room and broke the zipper of a locked bag and stole cash only even though a passport and credit cards were also in the bag. This happened while we were out on a Friday evening and we did not discover the theft until the next morning, when I noticed that the zipper on my bag had been pulled apart (the combination lock was still in place). When I reported it to the desk clerk he tried to convince me that no theft could possibly have occurred by printing out a record of entries (via key card) into the room. I pointed out the undeniable fact that zipper of my bag was broken and insisted that he called the police who arrived quickly. They examined my bag and told me to report the burglary to the police station that day at noon (when English translator would be available). I did this and found out that at least four other rooms had been burgled in the same hotel, same night, same method. I feel convinced that at least one hotel employee must be involved in these crimes, so I am writing this review to warn other travelers away.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: xalara
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic position for sight seeing around Barcelona. There's a mtero station within a few hundred yards and pretty much everything is within walking distance. The rooms were clean and breakfast is well worth paying for. But the rooms are quite noisy from the street and television is all in spanish .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms are small but clean”
Reviews.Author: alb32
Reviews.Content: We loved the location - it was across the street from the Franca train station, so we saved a bundle taking a train from the airport rather than a taxi! Also, you can walk to the Barceloneta beaches or the Gothic quarter in about 10 minutes. The rooms are small, but that was fine for us, since we were out most of the day. The room looked nice and it was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had a room facing the street, and we were worried about street noise, but with the windows closed and the A/C running, we slept soundly all night except one - on Friday night we were awakened by a group of drunken men singing loudly. It lasted about 15 minutes and then they left. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: itazuke58
Reviews.Content: We had a excellent stay at the Park...no kids and no groups. Staff was wonderful....nothing to complain about, though a couple of desk clerks were not a friendly as others...everyone else took an interest in our trip. I actually looked around for things that those typical complaining tourists will always find to complain about...there were a few, however, we wnet to Barcelona to see the sights, not ´move in´ to the hotel and make it our permament residence. A traveller´s visit to a city and stay in a hotel has a lot to do with their own attitudes and personalities. If you always expect things to be like home.....stay home!!! When our taxi picked us up early Sunday morning, two of the staff actually helped us take our luggage out and help put them in the car.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RickNewMexico
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed 2 days staying here while in barcelona. Location is excellent with many tapas bars within walking distance. Not elegant or plush by any means, and a rather run down lobby. Room was very comfortable however. I was actually most impressed by the remarkably powerful air conditioning. It gets hot in Barcelona and we were on the top floor. I have often been less than impressed by the AC in Europe even at much more expensive hotels. I actually had to turn the vents away from our bed (a great problem!) This was what I refer to as "Texas air conditioning"(anyone who has ever been to Houston will understand.) We pulled up the covers and slept great. Breakfast was well worth it, with an abundance of wonderful Spanish ham, pastries, etc. Second time we have stayed here and will not look anywhere else when we return to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfunky
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband just back from a three night stay. I'd spent ages researching the hotels in Barcelona and finally picked this one and overall I wasn't disappointed. We arrived late Thursday night and initially I was slightly disappointed with the size/charm of the room. I had requested and had confirmed that would get a large room with a balcony but my initial reaction was that the room was smaller/less funky than I expected. In the light of day however my feelings changed and the size of the room was more than adequate and it did have charming features such as the column in the room, and was very clean. Also the balcony overlooking the main avenue was really nice. We were in room 634 and had no noise issues whatsover. The breakfast was also much better than we expected. The location was excellent. The only slight criticism I'd make is the nighttime reception guy incorrectly informed us that there was only one place down the road where we could find something to eat at that late hour (1am ish). Having rejected that place, we actually found lots of outlets/bars in the El Born area (a minute or so away) which were serving food (e.g. takeaway pizza or tapas etc). Overall though we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!! A clean updated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: After spending previous nights in a small boutique hotel in Paris and an old outdated hotel in Italy, the Park Hotel Barcelona was a wonderful respite. The staff was efficient and helpful. The location is perfect. Across the street from the train station and close to the beach and gothic area. We wandered out the door of the hotel at all hours and never felt threatened. The rooms have recently been updated. Huge LCD TV with english speaking channels, pergo floors, new linens, fresh clean bathroom (My wife took a bath, so it HAD to be clean.), and power steel shutters on the windows to keep the noise out. The breakfast was surprisingly good. Eggs, bacon, breads of all types and so much more. And the service in the breakfast area was excellent! I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE headed for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CK1London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel last weekend and thought it was perfect for a weekend break. Great location, 2 mins from Gothic Quarter and about a 10 mins walk to the beach. Rooms are clean, shower is strong, bed was comfortable and breakfast was good. Only thing to note is that if you have a room at the front with a balcony you can hear the noise of the traffic and people on the streets, but only mildly. Just a warning if you're a light sleeper! Highly recommmend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGirl
Reviews.Content: I am 13 and for our summer holidays my Mum and Dad took me and my two older brothers to Barcelona for 4 days. We stayed here and I really enjoyed it. I shared a room with my brothers (aged 15 and 17). The room was very spacious with a nice clean bathroom. The bathroom was filled with clean towels every day and the beds were neatly made as well. We had a big balcony looking right over Barcelona. The hotel is right in the middle of Barcelona and has very nice restaurants near by. Perfect for shopping as the food market and La Rambla are very close. I would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place all around”
Reviews.Author: P00dleL0ver
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the money. The location is superb--in the cool Born-Ribera area (with fabulous restaurants and funky shops all around) very close to the Picasso Museum and Sta. Maria del Mar. You can also walk easily to the main Cathedral, La Rambla, Boqueria, and other Old City cites--and will be very glad NOT to stay @ the noisy, pickpockety, overcrowded Rambla area, where you can find somewhat cheaper rooms. The hotel is not fancy but the room was nice, beds very comfortable (impt to me) , clean, with a nice large bathroom. We had a room for 3 (I traveled w/ my mom and sister) and all of us were very comfortable. The breakfast was superb (and we are all cooks!), extensive, delicious. At home I'm a light b'fast eater but like to load up when in Europe--it allows you to have a much lighter lunch and thus save $. And I just loved the coffee! Antonio, who works the breakfast room, was our favorite 'thing' about the hotel. He was so sweet, helpful, and funny. Some of the people working at the desk were pretty blase, e.g., during short stints when the elevator wasn't working and when we needed help w/ car rental, but that seems to be the European way. Be sure to request a balcony. That made a real difference in the size (or rather the way the size of the room felt) and having sunlight, not just artificial light in the room was great. I was pleasantly surprised to have no problem w/ noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MNGirl10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was almost $200US per night for a double (Incl. breakfast), but well worth it for the location and comfort of the modern and very clean rooms. The picture of the hotel does not do it justice. We also stayed at Regencia Colon next to the Cathedral, which was not nearly as nice as Park Hotel on all levels. The wonderful Born neighborhood is literally a few steps from the entry to the hotel. This is an ideal location for adults who want to enjoy great shopping and nightlife, super easy subway access, but also sleep through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It.!!!!”
Reviews.Author: simo1912
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not have a pretty exterior,but dont be put off. Myself and my fiance have been twice now and probably will not stay anywhere else when we visit barcelona. Its modern with its wall mounted lcd tv, beautiful room and en-suite, stylish throughout its corridors and eating and drinking areas. Helpfull english speaking staff are very friendly and make for a great stay... as i said in the title LOVE IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: pat_andalucia
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel to stay if you want to visit Barcelona. Walking distance from everything, rooms are not that big but nobody goes in Barcelona to stay in its room anyway, staff is top notch, very kind and professional, they really love what they do and you feel it. We are a French couple living in Andalucia so we flew to visit Barcelona, we arrived ok, (it's not far) BUT my luggage didn't have the same luck... It's kind of depressing when you arrive with the idea that you will never see your belongings again... This was what i had in mind. The staff at the hotel assure me that is was kind of normal way to travel with spanish companies and that I shouldn't worry, i will get my stuff soon, everything was pretty much normal and under control... Well, knowing i was suddenly part of the "no luggage" group was kind of reassuring... I was no longer alone, i knew there were somewhere others dealing with no underwear for tomorrow. A new family. I got my luggage the day after my arrival... I recommand this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !!! Close to it all !!!”
Reviews.Author: CocoJax
Reviews.Content: Totally more than what we expected. Nice rooms, clean, modern, outstanding staff (very nice and helpfull). Breakfast was included. Excellent. Lots of great spanish aged ham, salami, cheeses, pastries, eggs, bacon, cereal, fresh fruit, breads. And gave us the opportunity to share with the staff. Nice people, more than happy to share history, stories, and help you with your day plans. A bed, bath, breakfast and personal tour planner included in the price. :-) The hotel is literally accross the street from a central train station. You can take a train from the airport to this stations for just over 2 euros. During our stay the train was experiencing some system improvements and was out of service, but a nice bus ran the same route twice an hour. Very safe area and walking distance to most points of interest. Good eating near. Excellent gelatto stores near by. You may be intimidated by its proximity to a major road. True, the road noise is there, but the hotel windows are very well insulated and mostly filter out any undesired noise. Totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mcolic
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it. Five peaceful nights. A godsend after a horrible apartment rental on the internet. Newly refurbished, huge plasma screens, extremely quiet, comfortable beds, great bathroom, helpful and courteous staff, right near the Born District and close to Olympic Park. Completely enjoyed Barcelona (our favorite European city so far, we are Americans living in Budapest with our teenage daughters) and the Hotel really was an oasis to return to at night. I would go there again, in a second. Nagyon jo szalloda!! Egy nagy IGEN! for my Hungarian friends!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: rottmom
Reviews.Content: Location is very good - especially if you are arriving or leaving from Franca train station (just across the street. Easy stroll through old quarter or waterfront. Rooms are clean but very plain and small. Excellent breakfast buffet includes eggs "sunny side up" (plus the usual scrambled eggs) and lots of other food choices. Hotel staff competent and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Service, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: measpinner
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel was a close to most tourist attractions, well worth the small price. Good breakfast and great bilingual (at least) staff. Clean and cosy. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Functional but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: jds9000
Reviews.Content: Just spent four night at the Park, and loved it. Room was a litte small but very clean and quiet. Great location, within 20 minutes of the Ramblas, Place de Catalunya, and the Gothic area at night is great. Plus the harbour is within 5 minutes walk (great for the aquarium). Close for the zoo too, which is fantastic, even has it's own dolphin show !!. We took the train direct to the Estacio de Franca, about 25 minutes, and it was just across the road from the hotel, and it was only €2.60 each. Don't take a taxi unless your really nervous as it will set you back some €30+ for the same trip.(2 people, 1 bag) In all, great trip friendly hotel which ticked all the boxes. If you want a pool then get a 4* + hotel, but for us this was 'just right'.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed at good prices”
Reviews.Author: ladyemily
Reviews.Content: For the prices we paid, Park Hotel was completely suitable. The rooms were cleaned completely every day - which is a massive relief for people who have been to the beach and filled their bathroom with sand! And the fully functioning air conditioning came in very handy. Plenty of toiletries provided, and we didn't have to call reception once during our stay to ask for extras or complain about anything. There was an issue with a powercut, but it was fixed as quickly as possible. Friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast is included, and although not particularly varied (the hot selection wasn't amazing), there was plenty of bread, cereals and yoghurts, as well as hot drinks and fruit juice. The location is as good as it could have got - for us, at least. You can walk anywhere centrally very easily, and it's only about a 15 minute walk to the beach or harbour. Plus it's out of the way, so you don't feel overwhelmed on a busy street every time you step out of the door. Lovely and quiet room (we were located at the back) so that the only loud noise we heard all week were the festival fireworks!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but don't use the phone!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy2109
Reviews.Content: Before I forget, one word of advice for the Park Hotel (which probably applies to most Spanish hotels? not sure): DO NOT USE THE PHONE IN YOUR ROOM. They don't disclose this in any place, but you will be charged 60 euro cents/minute for a local call. Yep, even if you're calling the restaurant next door. AND, I found to my dismay, even for calling a toll-free number. I had to change some travel arrangements with an airline, and called their Spain toll-free number. When I checked out, I was charged nearly 20 euro. Yikes. I told the management that they should make this clear in their phone instructions, especially because in the USA toll-free calls are always free, even from hotel phones. I travel frequently in Europe and have never been charged this much for a phone call. That being said, I very much liked the Park Hotel. Booked through Venere.com and was very happy with everything-- the price, the location, and the room itself. The staff was friendly (though I'm sure the guy at the front desk was silently cursing me while discussing the phone call charge). My room was very small, as a single, but perfect for me, very comfortable, with its own thermostat for A/C, and super clean. I also appreciated the user-friendly safe in the closet, so I could lock up my passport and wallet during the day and only carry a bit of cash with me (I'd heard Barcelona was famous for pick-pocketing. and the second night a woman 3 feet from me on a main street had her purse snatched. That's when I decided to leave the valuables in the hotel safe!) The bathroom was huge and had a full sized tub, which was heavenly after spending four days in London in a hostel. Great TV, including BBC world and National Geographic. Wonderful breakfast- eggs, bacon to fruit and cereal. Walking distance to the old city center (and the beach, though I wouldn't recommend Barcelona's beaches), and the Estacio de Franca across the street (a beautiful old station, not scummy like some city train stations) makes getting to the airport a dream. Even if you arrive at Sants station, you can jump on the airport trian (C10) in the opposite direction and be at Franca in 5 minutes. A great find, highly recommended. Barcelona in August is another story... avoid it! The quality of the hotel was probably the best thing about my stay there. I'd love to go back during another season of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: roles
Reviews.Content: We are budget travellers and, though not dirt cheap, this was one of the lowest priced hotels available over a summer weekend and it was a delight. The location was perfect. Almost across the road from the Franca station which has direct trains to the airport, around the corner from the Barceloneta metro station and a short walk to a lovely park containing the zoo and to a hop-on hop-off bus stop. The old town started just behind the hotel and we took an easy ramble through it to get to Las Ramblas, the main touristy boulevard. The beach front, with its masses of restaurants, was about a 10 minute walk, and a few minutes further was the start of the cable car that goes over the harbour area. The room was compact, but not small and tastefully decorated and (big plus) the air con worked well. Noise wise - the window was double glazed, but some muffled partying did carry up. Continental breakfast was good, but not brilliant and best of all was in a spacious room with attentive staff... (this is rare - breakfasts are usually cramped and rushed). The hotel had a bar which opened onto the street with tables and chairs on the pavement where one could sit and watch the passing scene - which buzzes until all hours. We had read that people only get going at 10-11pm, but did not realise there would be families (push chairs, toddlers, dogs) wandering around at midnight ! The staff were charming. The barman, with little English, but brilliant sign language, was lovely. I would be delighted to go back there. On another note: The hop-on hop-off bus routes are varied and long. It almost rivals London. There are two routes that take 4 hours (add some for the drivers who get off at stops and disappear for 5 minutes at a time) and a third that takes 2 hours. So if you are going to do this (recommended), leave a whole day just for doing the routes and not getting off much. We did the bus for a day to orientate ourselves and then bought a 10 trip metro/bus card to get back to places we could not walk to. Dress is very casual (shorts and slops all over, all times) and the city is very relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Find In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ksprang
Reviews.Content: My wife, 13 year old son, and I stayed here for two nights following a cruise. I read about the hotel on the web on multiple sites, including Trip Advisor. We wanted to be reasonably close to Las Ramblas and the Old City, and we wanted a reasonable price for the hotel, particularly given the poor exchange rate for the U.S. dollar. We were delighted with the result. The hotel is directly across from the Estacio Franco, so one can whisk from the airport to the hotel in an air conditioned train, cross the street, and enter the hotel. It is a short walk to the Picasso Museum, and the hotel backs up to the Ciutat Vella (Barri Gotic). We were also walking distance to the sea, and only a 30 minute walk from Sagrada Familia (a walk we would recommend) The room was reasonably spacious by European standards, with a fold out couch/bed for our son and two twins together as a double for my wife and me. The bath was actually large and spacious, and well equipped with every amenity from hair dryer to bidet to high pressure shower. Breakfast was included and to our surprise and enjoyment included eggs and bacon as well as wonderful croissants, fresh squeezed orange juice, cheese, and the traditional elements of a continental breakfast. Wireless Internet was also provided without additional charge. We enjoyed large bath towels, good air conditioning, a a free safe in the room for valuables. There is a lounge on the 1st or 2nd floor (lobby is 0) with comfortable chairs, etc. The staff was quite fluent in English and extraordinarily gracious and helpful. The hotel was perfect for our needs in every way--comfortable, reasonably priced, conveniently located, and aesthetically pleasing, as well as clean. We would readily return the next time we are in Barcelona. We had 4 or 5 star amenities at a 2 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AW25
Reviews.Content: We had a positive experience at the Park Hotel. Before our arrival, the staff was really helpful when working on our reservation over the course of several emails. The location (right by the Franca train station and in the cool, fun Born neighborhood) was excellent. Our room was small, but it was clean and sleek. We faced the alley on the side of the hotel, so it was completely quiet. Overall we felt like we found a good deal in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate test of any foreign hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Scree
Reviews.Content: ...is when one is sick. This is when quality comes out (or runs away at top speed). I am posting my review here very, very late because I only just stumbled over the journal entry about this hotel. We stayed here for a business conference and at first, it wasn't much to look at. But then it grew on me. Efficient use of space and pretty good sized bathroom...overall, clean, clean, clean. At a good location (across from the train station) and not too far from the metro, near La Catedral and not too far walking distance from las Ramblas but almost right around the corner from the best hole-in-the-wall-tapas and sangria place. Unfortunately, I enjoyed my sangria that nite so when I wrote the journal entry, I forgot to write down the name of the place (aside from the kudos on how awesome everything was). Breakfasts were the same every day but lots of food, a very friendly dining staff who kept us well plied with caffe con leche. Most importantly was how they treated me when I was sick. And I was so sick with the flu when I first arrived. No problems. They directed my partner to a nearby Farmacia, made sure he had lots of food and liquids to bring me on breakfast trays and most wonderfully, watched when I stumbled out for a 45 minute breath of fresh air so they could nip in, scrub the room thoroughly and nip back out.....all after normal cleaning hours too. Because of this helpful and caring attitude, what could have been the worst vacation due to illness, turned out to be one of the best I ever had - I was able to get better and totally enjoy my stay. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DigitalDude2008
Reviews.Content: Booked through Venere.com very efficiently. Good three night stay in early April. One double and one single room for our party of three. Pleasant well furnished and clean rooms, nice big TV with BBC World News. Excellent English speaking front desk and restuarant staff. Very nice breakfast. Hotel very convenient for train transfer from Airport and currently FREE as you have to use a short bus transfer to get to the station due to work in progress. You can walk to all the big attratctions from here and the beach too. Nice bar which unfortunately only open at restricted times, but the bar next door is good. The restuarant in same building has gone away but there are loads of places all within an easy walk. Just a shame about the ill disciplined children (English or US?) on floor above us who ran about till the early hours and a bunch of noisy Danes who made a very early departure on Sunday morning. We should have brought ear plugs, the other two nights were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: hartrit
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday. Thought the hotel was great. Staff were helpful but not over friendly. Asked for a room at the back, high up to avoid any noise. Plenty of choice for breakfast too. Perfect location we thought. Loved the area behind the hotel for restaurants/bars. Just across the road from the train station. For some reason on both journeys to and from the airport we didn't have to pay! Did we miss something?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: TheCanuckTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from the Franca train station - so great for those travelling by train! It's also very close to the main centre- so you can see the beaches, shops, and sites all within walking distance. The hotel was very clean, and the employees were fantastic! They spoke some English and were able to give us tips on where to go, eat, etc. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “good location, perfect for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: mthead
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for weekend with with friends, we had a double and triple room. While the rooms were compact they were perfect for our needs, We did not spend a lot of time in the Hotel. The bathroom in the double was however very small. The rooms were very clean and well serviced. The breakfast was included in our deal and it was fine, plenty of everything do not expect gourmet. We stayed in the front of the hotel and the noise from the busy street below did not bother us at all, it may bother others however. The Hotel is located near the Gothic district and is not too far from the marina and La Rambla. There are some great cafes and bars very nearby. If you want a reasonable priced hotel within walking distances of these places, I would recommend the Park Hotel. The staff were great too espeically the night porter.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the Park”
Reviews.Author: eurogirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I feel that the reviews were over complimentary about the Park Hotel. Maybe we got a crappy rate, 165 Euros for a twin with breakfast, but this seems pricey for a 3 star hotel. It paints itself as a boutique hotel but it definitely is not. The decor is tacky and chintzy. The location near El born was excellent but this was one of the only pros. For the same price I think you can stay in much nicer hotels in Barcelona that are also central. Our shower was blocked and would not drain, after 2 requests this was resolved, our rooms were often not serviced until 4pm, despite the fact we'd been out all day. I felt quite let down and would not return

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dre_NL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the centre of Barcelona between the Ramblas and the beach . The room was clean with good facilities (airco, wifi, LCD TV). The Barcelona turistic bus stops at 50 meters from the hotel. Great Hotel if you like to discover Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Lost-again2
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the first floor overlooking the alleyway on the left (when facing the hotel). One room (130) was spacious and quite good but we had problems with the other (129). In 129 we had a shutter that wouldn't open, air-conditioning that didn't work and the presistent smell of a smoking guest. On one morning the hot water was cold (this was for the whole hotel)! Breakfast was ok but on one morning there were some really over ripe fruit on offer. The hotel offered a cheaper rate (15EUR/day BEFORE VAT!) in the car-park around the corner. There was a bus stop for the tourist bus (blue line) just to the left when exiting the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sushiaddict
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 3 day stay at the park hotel in Barcelona. We booked the hotel the morning we went to barcelona on a hotel website as it was a last minute holiday so we really didnt know what to expect from the hotel. When we got to the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel room was great with air conditioning and a very modern decor. My boyfriend was extra impressed by the 30 inch flat screen tv and minibar in the room! The location is really great too. Its just around the corner from the metro. The bus turistic for the city goes from just down the road and its directly across the road from estacio de Franca which is the major station for trains going to and coming from France. About a 5 minute walk away is the aquarium and the pier where its nice to walk along and see all the boats and some good restaurants are located there too. It's only a 5-10 minute walk to the bottom of las ramblas but if you get the hang of walking up and down to the centre of the city you will find your way down all the shortcuts through the Gothic quarter where the streets are really narrow and quirky with some great cafes and shops. I really though that this hotel was good value, The hotel was only €80 a night which for the quality of the rooms, we thought was great value. I would definatley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very good 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Kerry10
Reviews.Content: Three of my friends and I have just returned from a 4 day stay in Barcelona where we stayed in the Park Hotel which was recommended to me by a colleague. This hotel is really a great 3 star so dont be fooled by the exterior view or the reception area. We booked 2 twin rooms and while 1 was definately larger than the other, they were still really comfortable and for a 3 night stay were definately perfect. It does seem that some of the rooms can be very small so it might be advisable to check and see if there are different room categories so that a larger room can be booked. the location of the hotel is really great with the "hop on hop off" tour bus stop a 1 min walk away and some really nice tapas bars in the area. It was really hot and busy in Barcelona and it was great to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel. Breakfast at the hotel is excellent, much better than a 3 star standard, with fantastic choice and the breakfast staff are excellent. Overall I would say this is probably the best 3 star hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and my friends and I are extremely fussy, ( we work in the hotel industry!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - just right.”
Reviews.Author: Darryl_Karoo
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel Barcelona was a very pleasant place to stay. We just got back from a 2-night stay there and certainly couldn't fault it for its 3-star rating - I'm not sure what it would need for four stars but it had everything we could need. The room was clean, in an excellent state of repair and decoration and everything worked. It was renovated in 1990 (17 years ago) but it has certainly been looked after since then. The 1950's design still shows through beautifully. For us, who like to wander around, the location was spot on. Next to the park, and about 2 minutes walk to the Gothic Quarter (great for the bustle of restaurants, bars and shops in beautiful buildings.) It would take maybe 15 minutes walk to Las Ramblas (if you REALLY want bustle) but the time taken was hard to judge as we took a leisurely meander through the streets, bars and shops, with plenty to occupy and distract you on the way. The marina and the beach are also only five minutes away. If you wanted to venture further, there are bus routes and metro stations very nearby. The other great part about its location is that the Estacion Franca (train station) is just across the road (no noise from that either!) We cautiously took a 25 euro taxi on the way in from the airport, but found that the train got us back to the airport in the same time (about 40 mins) for a mere 2.50 euros each! Our room was a simple double which overlooked a side street (no balcony, but I think some were available on other sides of the hotel). When I say side street, don't picture rubbish skips and winos - we were just facing another similar block of old buildings and roof terraces where normal Spanish people lived and hang out their washing on Sundays. We had one night when we heard a few late-night revellers staggering home but other than that we had a pleasant night's sleep. We certainly didn't suffer any noise from within the hotel as some other people have had. If I had to make a bad comment it would be about the breakfast (we didn't book dinner). While the food was reasonable and the choice was decent, they sometimes struggled to keep up with the steady flow of guests (get there before 9 to avoid the queues) so we were sometimes left scouring the crumbs of the half-empty buffet table. But, serves you right for being a lazy bones - get up early enough and then get exploring the city!
